intro: Genista barbara, commonly known as the Spanish broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and coastal areas. Its seed pods contain several seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread. Genista barbara is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
